newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Petrobras finds oil in record depth.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Petrobras finds oil in record depth.

text.p: State oil monopoly Petrobras has discovered oil 1,709 meters below the water's surface, a national record, the company said in a statement.
The well is situated at Marlim Sul 3 in the Campos Basin, off Rio de Janeiro state, and tests show a potential production of 5,000 barrels of oil and 70,000 cubic meters of gas daily.

The discovery is important as it adds 150 million barrels to its reserves as well as opens up the possibility of further production at these kinds of depths, the statement said. Petrobras currently holds the world record for production at a depth of 1,207 meters at the same Marlim Sul field.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
